intro: Tecticornia pluriflora, commonly known as the mulga or mulga grass, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its wiry,丛生 growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny white to pale blue flowers. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, with a deep root system that allows it to survive in dry conditions. Tecticornia pluriflora plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for native fauna.
